file_content.text: Once we understand the rakghouls' hunting habits, we can contain them. Then, we'll rebuild Taris just as it was.
Splendid work! I'm already receiving data transmissions from the bio-alarms. You've done the Republic's rebuilding effort a tremendous favor.
Those rakghouls were no trouble at all.
That was easy enough.
Thanks to you, the Republic's reclamation teams will soon be saying the same thing.
Happy to pitch in.
You've done far more than "help out," my friend.
It wasn't a favor, remember?
Oh, come now. Take a moment and give yourself a pat on the back before you dash off with your money.
What you've done most definitely calls for generous compensation. Good show!
It seems dangerous to stay out here all alone.
You sure you'll be alright?
I'm one hundred percent safer now with the bio-alarms in place. I'll be fine.
Hope it all works out.
Soon, we'll know how to contain the rakghouls. From there, eradication of these beasts will quickly follow.
You're easily amused, aren't you?
Sure thing, brainy.
I suppose I'm acting a bit foolish, but I can't contain my excitement.
Accept these credits with my extreme gratitude.
I'll begin collating my data. Thank you again for everything.
I need bio-alarms placed at all the survey stations. Hurry--knowledge waits for no one!
"Dear Adali, I regret that your husband was killed yesterday by rakghouls. Please accept my condolences. Doctor Soylon was an excellent scientist."
I've never composed a death notice before. How did that sound?
You might try softening the blow a little.
Pretty bad.
Really? Adali always impressed me as something of a stoic. Then again, she is a widow now. Hmm....
The "Dear Adali" part was pretty good.
It needs work.
I thought a personal touch was warranted, under the circumstances.
Why the blazes are you asking me?
I'm just delivering supplies.
I need an honest opinion, and all my colleagues are deceased.
Ah! I recognize the symbols on that container! My bio-alarms have finally arrived. Good, good.
If only this had arrived in time to save my associates. Not your fault, certainly. We knew the risk of studying rakghouls.
What do you think you're gonna learn about these things?
Studying?
How did you manage to survive by yourself?
It's amazing you're alive.
I do seem to have beaten the odds. Perhaps there's something about me these creatures don't like.
Apparently not.
The pursuit of knowledge is never without risk. And the greater the risk, the greater the enlightenment.
My colleagues and I were studying the rakghouls' behavior hoping to find a means of containing them.
We can't afford to let the rakghouls impede our progress. The Republic's rebuilding efforts on Taris are paramount to future prosperity.
What's so important about Taris?
Future prosperity?
This was a wonderful planet before the Sith destroyed it. The Republic must rebuild and show that Sith aggression will not stand.
You're pretty fearless, for a scientist.
I admire your spirit.
Fear obstructs understanding. Besides, my prospects for survival have just improved.
This disgusting toxic swamp isn't worth saving.
Give it up, already.
Give it time. Besides, I've just had an important breakthrough.
I've isolated an identifying element in the rakghouls' physiology, making it possible to detect and track their movements.
The bio-alarms you brought will reveal how the creatures hunt--however, installing them will be a challenge with all my assistants dead.
If you've got the credits, doc, I've got the time.
I'll do it, for a price.
Thanks to the rakghouls, I have a budget surplus for staff expenses. You're hired!
Consider them installed, doc. How hard can it be?
Sounds like you need a pro.
Indeed! All that's required are quick feet, basic technical know-how and raw nerve--things I see you possess in abundance.
Don't look at me. I'm done here.
Have fun with that, pal.
But these bio-alarms are useless until they're installed!
A good cause. I hate the shadow-bug-men.
I know a growl of agreement when I hear one. Please, I can't do this without you.
"Big-brain" here wouldn't last ten meters outside this camp. Besides, we can always use credits.
I have many credits to spare, and I do desperately need your help.
Without your help, many more innocent victims will perish.
I'll install your whatsits--but I'm not gonna enjoy it.
Fine, you win.
Don't be so sure. Taris can be quite lovely in the afternoons.
I guess I can spare the time.
Can't believe I'm doing this.
You're a hero to science, my friend.
Place a bio-alarm at each survey station we've established, and I'll see you're amply rewarded.
"Amply rewarded" is my middle name.
Consider it done.
Your parents must have been fascinating people.
If I get killed, I'm gonna be so mad.
I'd better not regret this.
The path of knowledge is fraught with peril, but we must tread it nevertheless.
And then we're through.
I'm sorry you feel that way, but I accept your conditions.
Come back when you're done, and we'll celebrate your success.
Normally I'd ask for your next of kin's holofrequency, but I'd rather maintain some optimism. Good luck!
If you're going to tromp about Taris, be careful. I've lost two-and-a-half researchers to the rakghouls.
What a shame you don't care about science... oh well....
I'm busy, got it? Find somebody else.
Not my problem.
Very well. I'll just wait for new colleagues to arrive and hope the rakghouls don't eat me in the meantime.
I'll notify the Republic you delivered my shipment. Goodbye.
